items.content_html: A Queue is a linear data structure that keeps its elements in a queue. It uses FIFO (first-in-first-out) ordering in which elements are added to the "end" and are removed from the "front".
items.title: Data Structures: Queue
items.summary: A Queue is a linear data structure that keeps its elements in a queue. It uses FIFO (first-in-first-out) ordering in which elements are added to the "end" and are removed from the "front".

items.content_html: A Stack is a linear data structure that keeps its elements stacked on each other. It uses LIFO (last-in-first-out) ordering in which the last pushed item to the stack is processed first.
items.title: Data Structures: Stack
items.summary: A Stack is a linear data structure that keeps its elements stacked on each other. It uses LIFO (last-in-first-out) ordering in which the last pushed item to the stack is processed first.

items.content_html:
Linked list is a linear data structure, this means that there is a sequence and an order to how they are constructed and traversed.
The linked list data structure is a good choice over arrays when you don't need to have random/indexed access to your data...
items.title: Data Structures: Linked List
items.summary:
Linked list is a linear data structure, this means that there is a sequence and an order to how they are constructed and traversed.
The linked list data structure is a good choice over arrays when you don't need to have random/indexed access to your data...

items.content_html: In this article, we are going to explore React lifecycle methods. As for me, if you want to work with React this knowledge is crucial because you need to be able to implement component logic in the right place.

items.content_html: console.log is one of the most basic and common debugging tools in JavaScript. However, the console object gives us more methods to make debugging easier.
items.title: JS Console API tips
